Thy turfy mountains, where live nibbling sheep, and flat meads thatch'd with stover, them to keep;
Thy banks with pioned and twilled brims, which spongy April at thy hest betrims;
To make cold nymphs chaste crowns; and thy broomgroves;
Whose shadow the dismissed bachelor loves;
Being lass-lorn: thy pole-clipt vineyard; And thy sea-marge, sterile and rocky-hard, where thou thyself dost air; the queen o' the sky, whose watery arch and messenger am I;
Bids thee leave these, and with her sovereign grace, here on this grass-plot, in this very place;
To come and sport: her peacocks fly amain:

In the last moment, the witch saves the piper and the champion slays the evil dragon.

But Selena's email was like a rock that sank to the bottom of the sea and caused no ripples.
She waited three more days and decided to send another email. This time, she attached her work and pleaded to tell the recipient about her dream and plan for the exhibition.
Two days later, she finally received a reply. The manager refused her request and didn't even tell her why.
After some hesitation and thought, she decided to have a talk with the manager face-to-face to plead once again.

Selena filed a request to the exhibition center's online system and asked to meet the new manager. She arrived early at the meeting room, but the manager never came until the center was almost about to close.
The manager didn't recognize me. That... calmed me somehow.
The manager was impatient with Selena's persistence. He took the documents and files, which Selena carefully put together, only to take a quick glance at them.

The manager accented on the word 'free.'
Selena immediately said she would be willing to rent a stall and sign an insurance contract in case the stall was damaged in any way.
But the manager didn't take the offer.
Instead, he waved his hand, turned around, and turned on his communication device.
Selena kept a polite distance and waited patiently.
Selena was persistent and not about to give up anytime soon. The manager realized she would not let him be if they didn't draw a conclusion to this discussion.
So, he turned off his communication device and took a deep breath as if he was making a big decision.

...At least it involves fighting. You have one day to use the exhibition stall. And you can pick one of our partners' gaming samples to create a package, so that you can show your play during the in-game loading screen.
Her heart was racing. After the manager left and she could no longer hear his footsteps, she placed her hand on her heart and crouched slowly.

Her mixed feelings were overwhelming. She was incredibly excited and exhilarated, even more so than she was right before 'The Acadia Evacuation' debuted. She could hear her veins pulsing and her heart pounding.

It was probably because her blood was coursing faster, which gave more pressure to the blood veins. She felt a bit sad somehow. The suffocating feeling came rushing in just as quickly as it vanished. She breathed gently.
I realized back then how lucky I was to build that makeshift stage and make the play happen.
I was also lucky to meet audiences that knew to appreciate the play and like-minded friends.
After that, it was a stressful preparation.
Selena didn't tell anyone about this and didn't share her feelings and thoughts with anyone either.

It was a 1-on-1 duel between her and herself only. She wouldn't let anyone help. Selena prepared alone and made sure to follow the guidelines given by the manager: breaking down the story, replacing unnecessary parts with interactive gaming content... She worked hard to mix the play with games.
'Mix' might not be the most accurate word for it, but the partner's gaming sample is centered around combat and doesn't really leave any room for storytelling.

If she forced her stories into the game, it would be too awkward and out of place. The players who came to enjoy the combat would likely lose their patience. But if she omitted too many parts of the story, the play would be confusing to the audience who had an interest in exploring the story.
Facing all these challenges, she wasn't planning to back down. She had something to show in its most original form. This was her only chance.
Introduction, connection, transition, and ending. The most important part was to bring an immersive experience to the audience and prevent them from distracting them.
An idea came to Selena's mind. What if she used the windows between battles to bring everyone a vintage, calming fantasia in the form of recitative?
That would fill the blank in this gaming sample with colors and hopefully make everything lively.
Then, on the exhibition day, she sent the software to the manager and arrived at the center early, waiting.

The staff started to get things ready in the exhibition center. This was the first time they demonstrated gaming samples. There were comment systems set up next to the exhibition stalls, so that the audience could leave their comments after experiencing something.
